item.title: Cooking with Coroutine Recipes @CodemotionAmsterdam
item.author: nisrulz@gmail.com (Nishant Srivastava)
item.description: Codemotion Amsterdam 2020, Amsterdam, Netherlands Abstract Kotlin Coroutines graduated to stable release just last year and are fairly new for everyone adopting them.

item.title: Kotlin MP: Into the Multi-Verse @FOSDEM
item.author: nisrulz@gmail.com (Nishant Srivastava)
item.description: FOSDEM 2020: Kotlin Devroom, Brussels, Belgium Abstract Kotlin Multiplatform is the new kid on the cross-platform block. The approach although is very different from what you have seen in the past.

item.title: My love-hate relationship with Android Studio @Devfest'19 Berlin
item.author: nisrulz@gmail.com (Nishant Srivastava)
item.description: Devfest'19 ‘19, Berlin, Germany Abstract Android Studio is the tool of the trade hands down. When it comes to Android (app/library/IoT) development, the first thing that comes to mind is to install Android Studio and get going from there.

item.title: Cooking with Coroutines Recipes @Mobilization IX
item.author: nisrulz@gmail.com (Nishant Srivastava)
item.description: Mobilization IX, Łódź, Poland Abstract Kotlin Coroutines graduated to stable release just last year and are fairly new for everyone adopting them. That means a lot of the information is not quite straightforward when it comes to implementing them in current projects.
